<OLD>

> " I've already lost him twice, I will NOT lose him a third time!"

<NEW>

Tuscon's voice bounces erilly off the different buildings, distorted
and changed somehow and then reflected back. Quite clearly Tuscon
could hear his own voice coming back, "LOST . . . LOST . . . Lost . .
. Lost . . . lost . . . "

<OLD>

> He narrows his eyes, and in a running start he transforms into truck mode, and rolls his tires swiftly over the ground,kicking up dust beneath them. He was adament about reaching Rodimus and was not about to let anything get in his way.
>
> "Rodimus, if you can hear me, keep talking to me. If we keep in touch with each other it will be easier to be reunited. Where are you? And what direction are you headed?"

<New>

There is no response from Rodimus from radio or otherwise to Tuscon's
call. All that he can hear is the background static of the
communication open lines.

However he does hear something, a strange femenine voice that comes
simultaniously over his radio and somehow from the air around him. One
that sounds distinctly alien and yet all too familiar at the same
time. "He is no longer yours. You are too late . . . . ."

Even as the voice was speaking a door on one of the manufacturing
plants beeped. Under normal conditions the sound would have been so
small so as to go unoticed, but here on this silent and unmoving
street the sound was almost strident as with a rumble the door began
to raise, revealing inky blackness inside.

" . . . . . I have given you his carapase," The voice continued, "but
his spark belongs to the horde . . . . ."

From the shadows within three insect or spider like creatures stepped
out, their clawed feet making high pitched scratching noises on the
steel of the street. They looked like wicked, mishappen spiders with
long claw like appendages. Thier bodies were all well armored colored
in reds, yellows, and blacks - looking distinctly like Rodimus'
colors, even if a bit backwards and darker. Each one stood twice as
tall as Tuscon himself when in robot mode and much wider.

" . . . . . And now, so will yours!" The voice finished and lapsed
into silence.

The creatures looked around as if sniffing the air as they slowly
began to orient on Tuscon!

Meanwhile Tusonc's radar gave him, not quite a ping, but a 'pull'.
Something that he couldn't quite make out was almost calling him.
Above him, perhaps 50 feet in the air, an automatic magna-railcar
moved along its track that would take it through and eventually around
the city. The hum of its supsensor beams breaking the silence that
lives on the open street. It was from there that the pull seemed to
resonate.

The insects so far seemed to be only noting Tuscon as the three began
moving with surprising speed in his direction.

(TAG)

Preston
